20005000.text: (For such a big ranch, it doesn't look like there are many people working here.)

20005001.text:
(That man must be the owner of this ranch. He looks pretty down...
I should go ask him if he needs help.)

20005002.text: Who the heck are you? This here's private property!

20005003.text: Hello there... you look troubled. What's happened here?

20005004.text:
Well... This ranch used to be the biggest operation 'round these parts. Used to have lots of staffs, too.
But with all that funny business happenin'... the livestock dyin' and such... it's made things mighty hard on us.

20005005.text:
Most of my workers ran away, and I can hardly blame 'em...
Still, there's a lot to be done around here but not enough people to lend a hand. What am I s'posed to do?

20005007.text:
Ya will? Well, by the Spirits!
All right then, let's get ya started.

20005008.text:
Let's see... All right, I ran out of hay to feed my babies. Let's get that taken care of first.
You can get it from <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Bulbaries</> and <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Gnarloxes</> 'round the ranch.

20005009.text:
Place the hay <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>here and there throughout the ranch</>, so my babies can eat it.
If ya still have some hay left, then ya can put it in my <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>storage</> right here. Thank y'all!

20005010.text: (There's a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Dead Sheep</> over there. I should go take a closer look.)

20005011.text: (It's still warm. It hasn't been dead for long.)

20005012.text: (These are stab wounds, perhaps from a knife. It must have been killed by a person.)

20005013.text: (The culprit can't have gone too far. I should follow their traces.)

20005014.text: (I've discovered a suspicious-looking <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>hidden cave</> at the end of the trail of Dead Sheep.)

20005015.text: (I'd better make sure they'll never dare get near the ranch.)

20005016.text: (I should report what I did, about the illegal slaughterhouse, and about Makara.)

20005017.text:
So that darned <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Poacher Gang</> were the ones going after my babies!
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Makara</>'s always given me the creeps, but to think he would go so far as to do this...

20005018.text:
Thank the Spirits the Saho brought all his shady behavior to light...!
I'm real thankful that ya not only helped me around the ranch, but also delivered some justice.

20005019.text:
I'm sure my babies are also thankin' ya from their graves...
Once I get word of this to the Saho, they'll help me deal with 'em, and my workers will come back!

20005020.text: (Judging by the way she's dressed, she must be a member of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Plum Blossom</>.)

20005022.text:
You were here! I'm glad I didn't miss you.
I've heard the news. The ship to Haewol can't take off because of some material issues. Is that true?

20005023.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, I have something to ask you to do.
If it's fine with you, could you give us a hand?

20005025.text:
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Blue Bandits</> in the Sapphire Basin are growing stronger.
We tightened our security to keep them in check, but they've somehow managed to keep growing.

20005026.text:
Because they've been causing so much damage on the residents and the Saho's businesses,
the Saho hired a <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>spy</> to keep an eye on them.

20005027.text:
This spy told us that <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>a member of the Sapphire Basin</> is in league with them.
We need someone to infiltrate the Blue Bandits and find out who this person is.

20005028.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, what you did the last time impressed the Saho so much that they'd like to trust you with this task.
Could you help? Of course, we'll repay you accordingly.

20005030.text:
Then, you can get more information about your task at the Abandoned Tile House on the way to the Blue Bandits camp.
Our spy is waiting for you there.

20005031.text: (First, I should go to the Abandoned Tile House to meet the spy.)

20005032.text: (I should try to talk about the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Saho</>.)

20005033.text:
Shhh! Be quiet.
Lower your voice! What if someone hears you?

20005036.text:
I can't believe they sent someone who looks as frail as you on this mission.
Call me a skeptic, but I need to see if you've got what it takes.

20005038.text:
You're better than I thought, but it's not enough.
Being one of the Blueskin Thieves is all about strength, and you're not strong enough to be one.

20005039.text:
Even if you managed to join us, you couldn't get even near the boss.
What? Why do you have to join us? Ugh. Okay, listen up. I'm not going to explain this twice.

20005040.text:
We bring in our military supplies from outside, and recently their numbers have increased.
They might contain some clues, but the problem is that they're stored in the boss's tent.

20005041.text:
And not many people are allowed in his tent.
I'm not suicidal enough to try that on my own. You'll have to do it, and that requires joining and meeting the boss.

20005042.text:
Let me see... What can we use to bribe your way in?
Ah! That's right. There's something you can hunt to both prove your skills and impress the boss at the same time.

20005044.text:
The humongous frog monster <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ribbita</> lives in
a cave at the back of our camp.

20005045.text:
The boss tried to get rid of it, but failed miserably.
People talked about that behind his back for a long time.

20005046.text:
Since then, that monster has been a thorn in his side.
I bet he'll see you if you bring him its head.

20005047.text:
I'll go check the monster. Follow me secretly.
If you don't want to die in the middle of enemy territory, that is.

20005048.text: (This must be the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>place</> Chiyun was talking about.)

20005050.text:
Huh? What are you? You don't look like you're one of us.
Guys, get him out of here. Bury him.

20005051.text: I come bearing Ribbita's head! With this bounty, I humbly request to join your esteemed group.

20005052.text:
Wait a minute. Th-this...
And what? You want to join my group? Why?

20005053.text:
I've heard rumors of your strength,
and I can tell the rumors were not exaggerated.

20005054.text:
Ahem. Well, not to brag, but I, Stonefist, am second to none when it comes to fighting.
So, you want to join my group, huh? Alright, you're in. Err, just don't tell anyone else that you're the one who hunted this.

20005055.text: You have my word. However, may I speak with you in private?

20005056.text:
Hey, you're a fresh recruit. You don't get to talk to me in private.
You hunted something I couldn't... so what? If you want a chance to talk to me in private, earn it!

20005058.text:
What happened?
Did you get in?

20005059.text: (I should fill him in on what happened.)

20005060.text:
Tsk. That's his pride talking. Well, I expected as much.
As you might have guessed, the boss is very materialistic. He'll probably talk to you in private if you bring him a gift.

20005061.text:
However, that gift would have to be extremely valuable or famous...
Ah, I've heard the Poacher Gang operating up north recently got ahold of a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>famous sword</>.

20005062.text:
It's called the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Sword of Truth</>, or something like that... anyway, that'll probably be enough to grant you an audience...
But taking it from the Poacher Gang is going to be tough.

20005063.text:
By the way, if you gather some Saberfang Leather on your way back, it'd come in handy for us.
I'll meet you at the Abandoned Tile House when everything's finished, okay? Well then, good luck.

20005064.text:
(It's hard to find clues with so many Poacher Gang members about.
I should clear out the ones hindering my progress and find the Sword of Truth.)

20005065.text: (Judging by the shape and location, that has to be the tent of the Poacher Gang boss.)

20005066.text:
(There's a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>treasure chest</> in the back.
Maybe it holds the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Sword of Truth</>.)

20005067.text: Huh? Why did you come back?

20005068.text: I come bearing the Sword of Truth.

20005069.text:
Sw-sw-sw-sword of Truth? How did you!
I-is this really it? The Sword of Truth?

20005071.text:
Ahhhh! Th-the stag leg that you stole last time!
I-I was the one who ate it! Ahhhhh!

20005072.text: And the guy who spread rumors about you being constipated is that bald guy!

20005073.text:
The Sword of Truth...
Hahaha... Mwa hah hah! I am invincible!

20005074.text:
You're quite something! All right! I feel great!
Wait right here, I will... yeah! A gift! I'll bestow you a gift! Hahaha!

20005075.text:
And you, tell the bald guy to come find me.
Tell him not to even think about running.

20005076.text:
Say, did you find anything? Good, so not all our hard work went to waste.
What? A witness? Hurry, we'd better leave before that Stupidfist—I mean, Stonefist finds out.

20005079.text:
It's a signal flare. You're supposed to shoot it when you're done.
Now, I'd better go before Stonefist comes after me. Good luck.

20005080.text: (I should give Hayon the evidence of Makara's betrayal from the Blue Bandits boss's tent.)

20005081.text: This is...! To think that even the Blue Bandits were under Makara's control...

20005083.text:
I should report to the Saho with this irrefutable evidence.
We'll talk about how to deal with the Blue Bandits after this.

20005084.text:
Even though their influence is not what it used to be, we're bound to make a mistake if we act hastily.
Don't worry, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>. We won't let this opportunity you've made for us go to waste.

20005085.text:
We should return now and report to the Saho.
We thank you on behalf of both the Sapphire Basin Residents and the Saho.

20005086.text: The village's atmosphere is so heavy and somber... what happened here?

20005087.text: <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Our children</> have been going missing over the past few days.

20005088.text:
Are you not from around here? Be careful. The people of Soho are not exactly feeling friendly toward strangers at this moment.
You should leave as soon as you can.

20005089.text: I heard about what happened and want to help.

20005090.text:
Mm? But I don't even know you. Hm...
Ordinarily I would never listen to an outsider, but I can't be choosy right now.

20005091.text:
However, you'd better be quick. The Soho villagers are getting angrier by the day because of this.
The missing children might not survive for long, either...

20005092.text: Of course. Where are the children's homes located?

20005093.text:
There are three families: <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Taebak's</> above here, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Magayo's</> on the edge of the village, and <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Gasa's</> down below.
I don't want to make my villagers any more agitated than they already are. Please find them quickly and quietly.

20005094.text: (I should explain my conversation with the Soho Village Chief and ask where the children were last seen.)

20005095.text:
...Near the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Deep Forest Graveyard</> up north, or so I was told.
He always wanted to go in there. I don't know how many times I yelled at him because of it.

20005096.text: I knew one day he'd give into the temptation...

20005097.text: What do you mean by that?

20005098.text:
Because that forest is in such an isolated area, people come from all over to bury bodies there illegally.
Everyone around here knows that it's filled with the angry spirits of the dead.

20005099.text:
Recently, Dukgu has been talking nonsense about some gold buried in there, so I reamed him out...
Oh, my Dukgu!

20005100.text: (I should explain my conversation with the Soho Village Chief and ask where the children were last seen.)

20005101.text: Investigation? The Chieftain? My child... Can you find my child?

20005103.text:
My... My Chunme...
The last time I saw her, she was heading for the swamp to the west of the village.

20005104.text: She left early in the morning and didn't come back till late. My husband and I looked everywhere for her, and...

20005105.text: (Magayo is crying and unable to talk anymore.)

20005107.text: Err, Dad left with Mom to find my sister. Who are you?

20005108.text: I'm here to find your sister. Where did you last see her?

20005109.text:
Err, she said she was going to get some mushrooms. That was a couple of days ago.
She's still not home, and Dad and Mom have been crying.

20005110.text:
Dukgu hasn't come home yet, either.
Do you know when my sister will be back?

20005111.text: She'll be back soon. Stay home until your parents return, okay?

20005112.text: (This rock has <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>chunks of moss</> on it.)

20005114.text: (A <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>piece of cloth</> is hanging on the branch.)

20005115.text: (Close up, it looks as if it was torn from some clothes.)

20005116.text: (There's a chaotic array of footprints that stand out from everything else in the swamp.)

20005117.text: (There are multiple sets of smaller and bigger footprints leading toward the Deep Forest Graveyard.)

20005118.text: (Here on the ground there are broken twigs from trees growing in the Deep Forest Graveyard.)

20005119.text: (Someone must have transferred them here unknowingly.)

20005120.text: (There's an empty, half-broken <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>basket</>. It must have gone unnoticed by others because it was left under a tree.)

20005121.text: (It must belong to the girl who went to gather mushrooms with Dukgu.)

20005122.text: (There are multiple sets of smaller and bigger <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>footprints</>.)

20005123.text: (The footprints lead deeper into the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Deep Forest Graveyard</>.)

20005124.text: (That must be the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Spirit</> they talk about in myths and legends.)

20005125.text: (It looks as if it's motioning for me to follow.)

20005126.text: (The <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Child Spirit</> disappeared right before my eyes. It's gone somewhere far away.)

20005127.text:
(The fluttering <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Child Spirit</> is hardly visible because of all the entities around it.
I should put them to rest as I follow it.)

20005128.text: (How far is it going to go? Wait...)

20005129.text: (There's a <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>child</> crying under a tree. I should hurry.)

20005131.text:
Ah... Are you a person...? Not a ghost?
Did you come to save me?

20005132.text:
Shh, you should lower your voice... yes, I'm here to save you.
What's your name? Have you seen the other children?

20005133.text:
M-my name is <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Dukgu</>. The others? I don't know...
Some man said there was—boohoo! Home! I just want to go home. Boohoo!

20005134.text: It'll all be okay, I promise. Run straight ahead and get out of here as fast as you can.

20005137.text: (There's another <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>child</>, just as I expected. I should get to her quickly.)

20005138.text:
Mmh... It's so cold...
Huh, where am I? Who are you?

20005139.text: I'm here to help. What's your name?

20005140.text:
I'm... <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Chunme</>.
This is weird... I was in the swamp. How... Where am I?

20005141.text: You're in the Deep Forest Graveyard. Have you seen the other children?

20005142.text:
I heard a girl's voice.
She sounded like Sohyang...

20005143.text: Yes. Now, go and run straight ahead to the outskirts of the Forest.

20005144.text: (The <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Child Spirit</> that was just here a moment ago is gone.)

20005145.text: (Fortunately, I know where to go, based on the direction I've been heading so far.)

20005146.text:
(I can't see anything because it's so crowded.
Let's search for the child while clearing the area.)

20005147.text:
(The <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Child Spirit</> disappeared right in front of me. Wait. This is...!
There are <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>bloodstains</>. This can't be a good sign.)

20005149.text:
(Before I could even open my mouth to ask where the child is, the Child Spirit disappeared.
Wait... I just heard footsteps from behind me.)

20005150.text:
Teehee! I did as <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>he</> asked.
I'm going to be rich now!

20005151.text:
I wasn't going to do this, but—
Who's there?

20005152.text:
(It's a <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Child Spirit</>. And... the spirit of a young child? She looks as if
she's about to speak...)

20005153.text: Thank you for punishing that evil man, warrior.

20005154.text: I'm so sorry I didn't come earlier...

20005155.text:
Don't. I'm okay. I'm just... worried about my mom and dad and my brothers.
Could you tell them I'm okay?

20005156.text:
I will. and I swear that
Makara will be punished for this

20005157.text: (I can feel her gratitude as I watch the spirit fade away along with the Child Spirit.)

20005158.text: (I should relay what happened to Nobulman, the Soho Village Chief.)

20005159.text:
I see. At least two of the three made it back home.
You did well. Thank you.

20005160.text:
I find it hard to take in what that culprit said...
I knew <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Makara</> was no upstanding citizen, but to think he would go so far...

20005161.text: I'll talk to <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sohyang's parents</> in person.

20005162.text:
If you want to do that, go ahead.
Everyone's gathered in the center of the village to see the children, but you'd have to visit Sohyang's family yourself.

20005163.text: And don't worry about everything else. We'll take care of it.

20005164.text:
Where? Where's my <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sohyang</>?
The others are back... What happened to my Sohyang?

20005165.text: (As much as it pains me... I have to deliver the news of Sohyang's death and the last message from the Child Spirit.)

20005167.text:
Oh, Sohyang!
Mommy can't live without you. Oh, Sohyang!

20005169.text: (I feel torn apart. If only there was a way to soothe their hearts...)

20005171.text:
We can no longer withstand the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Consumed Monsters'</> and <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Steelfang</>'s continued assault. Therefore, I have decided to abandon the village.
All Ploggles who have seen the Evacuation Order shall immediately move to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Ploggle Temporary Base</> to the north, plog.

20005172.text:
And if there is anybody who is reading this order, please do listen to the voices of the Ploggles, plog.
Lend us your powers so that we can regain our village, plog! - Ploggle Chieftain Dawa

20005173.text: (Looking around the village after reading the order, I can't help but think of the destroyed village.)

20005174.text: (The temporary shelter was at the north. I'll go and lend my strength.)

20005175.text: I-is someone out there? H-help this Ploggle!

20005177.text:
Yes, plog! Something's blocking the door and I can't get out.
Help this Ploggle, please!

20005178.text:
This seems breakable...
Get back as far as you can!

20005179.text:
Thank you so much for saving me, plog.
I would have died of dehydration if it weren't for you.

20005180.text:
My name is Wawa, plog! But where did all my people disappear to?
Why is the village like this, plog?

20005181.text: I saw the Ploggle Chieftain's order on the signboard.

20005182.text:
Oh, no. Then, I must go, too, plog!
Hey! I want to pay you back, plog! Please come to our temporary base, plog!

20005183.text:
Thank you for coming. Please take this, plog.
Thank you for saving me earlier!

20005184.text:
What happened?
You Ploggles seem to be in a bad situation.

20005185.text:
This used to be our village, but a hole appeared in the sky one day and strange creatures started pouring out.
They took our village and killed all of my friends! I won't just sit idle, plog!

20005186.text:
We did our best to get rid of them, but we just weren't enough, plog.
Our chieftain ultimately had to order an evacuation.

20005187.text: By the way, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, why are you here, plog?

20005188.text:
I was wandering around the village when I saw the Evacuation Order left by the Ploggle Chieftain.
How can I help?

20005189.text:
Does that mean you are here to help us, plog?
If that's true, the Chief will be thrilled, plog! Go meet him plog!

20005190.text:
You're a person! What brings you here?
We're preparing to take back our village, so we can't exactly throw a welcome party right now, plog.

20005191.text: I happened to see the Evacuation Order and wanted to help.

20005192.text:
You've come to help us, plog?
How do you even plan to do that?

20005193.text: No one's better than me at fighting.

20005194.text:
Seeing how you came all the way here, I don't think you're lying, plog.
We have no more options left at our disposal and we could even use the help of a Bulbari if one would lend it, plog.

20005195.text: To the front, we have the terrible monsters occupying our village, and the hideous monster Steelfang is threatening the temporary shelter at our backs. We can't stand it anymore, plog.

20005196.text: Each problem should be solved one at a time. What needs to be solved first?

20005197.text:
Then, could you take care of those arrogant monsters first, so we can reclaim our village, plog?
Also, if you see any of my people who haven't been evacuated yet, please tell them to come here.

20005198.text:
Thank you, plog. It's been much more helpful than we thought.
Now there's only one thing left... We should eliminate <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Steelfang</>.

20005200.text:
Wait, just wait a minute. You're being too hasty.
We've also lost many warriors to Steelfang in the past. We must proceed with caution, plog!

20005201.text:
I don't know how long Steelfang has been in that valley, but what I do know
for sure is that someone purposely lured it there, plog.

20005202.text:
Although Steelfang is strong and has a tough hide, I'm sure we can pull it off if we do it together!
Come find me in front of the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Creepy Valley</> when you're ready, plog!

20005203.text:
It's a disaster plog! The Chief and warriors have been defeated!
Please go and help us!

20005204.text:
I'm fine, plog. Anyways...
I'm not what's important right now.

20005205.text:
Look at this! This is the pet <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>insignia</> that Steelfang had.
Doesn't this <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>seal</> belong to <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Makara</>, plog?

20005206.text: (I'm shocked by the extent of Makara's evil deeds...)

20005207.text:
If Makara really let Steelfang loose, it's obvious why he did it, plog.
I'm glad he was caught before he caused more trouble.

20005208.text:
Thanks to you, we took care of Steelfang without losing any more lives, plog.
Now, we can focus on rebuilding our village.

20005209.text:
There! I see Wawa.
Go speak to him!

20005210.text: Ah! I found you, meow! Do you know how long I've been looking fur you?

20005211.text: Why were you looking for me?

20005212.text: We must go to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Moonwater Harbor</> right now, meow!

20005214.text:
My Spirits, you're such a dense person! I don't have time to explain!
There's news that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Makara</> has fled toward the shipyard in Moonwater Harbor, meow!

20005215.text:
It will be a disaster if Makara gets away while we mingle, meow!
Go quickly! The Saho also said they'd be headed there!

20005216.text: (I feel like all I can do is nod because of Dondon's urging.)

20005218.text: (Makara is crouching in the corner, trembling.)

20005219.text: (He looks all roughed up. He was probably trying to escape using an illegal ship.)

20005220.text: (I have to catch Makara before he runs away.)

20005221.text: (I'll get Makara's attention in a threatening way.)

20005222.text:
Wahh! Wait, wait a minute!
I really didn't do anything wrong!

20005223.text:
Everything you've done to instill fear in Sapphire Basin
has all been proven through solid evidence.

20005224.text:
Eek... Eeeek! Y-you leave me little choice!
I've thought ahead, you know!

20005225.text: Now, my mercenary, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Big Mountain</>! Take care of this schmuck!

20005229.text:
Tsk, tsk. He wasn't a bad sort.
He simply lost his mind after Haewol was discovered.

20005230.text:
Makara, as of this moment,
you're no longer the owner of the Fishbelly Pub.

20005231.text: You've lost the support of your members.

20005233.text:
Would you rather be dead? 
You can come to work at our shipyard and experience the value of hard labor.

20005234.text: I used to be so powerful...

20005235.text:
Now that the situation is sorted out, we should get back to work.
I've neglected my shop for too long because of this problem.

20005236.text:
I've still got unfinished business with <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, so please head back first.
And Makara... we'll discuss the punishment befitting your crimes when we get back.

20005237.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, thank you so much.
We couldn't have done this without you.

20005238.text: This is an additional reward from the Saho.

20005239.text: I'm glad that everything worked out.

20005240.text:
We're going to form a disciplinary committee for Makara.
We'll make sure he pays for what he has done.

20005241.text:
We Saho will focus on restoring order to the Sapphire Basin.
For that... we'd like you to help us, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>.

20005242.text: Thanks, but I'm going to leave to Haewol soon.

20005243.text:
<textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Haewol</>... That's a shame.
But, I guess someone like you <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></> should naturally veer towards a bigger stage.

20005244.text:
Hm... <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, I believe we will meet again someday.
If we do, I'll be sure to come to your aid.

20005245.text: (Huh? You see a few familiar faces gathered in front of you.)

20005246.text: (Hayon seems to be beckoning me forward?)

20005247.text: (Let's go see if something has happened.)

20005248.text: Why are you all standing here?

20005249.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, thanks to your efforts,
the Saho were able to get to the bottom of this issue.

20005250.text: The Saho will be addressing the entirety of the Sapphire Basin Residents...

20005251.text: We would like you to attend this event, as <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></> has played a crucial role.

20005252.text: Well then, we'll be waiting for you at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>New Fishbelly Pub</>.

20005253.text:
Hello. I'm Mehwa, the Plum Blossom Supervisor.
I'm sure everyone knows there's been a lot of terrible events all over Sapphire Basin recently.

20005254.text:
The Saho have secretly investigated everything,
and we've found that all of them were connected to one particular individual.

20005255.text: Here, this wooden register! This is the proof!

20005257.text:
He's undermined our security, put pressure on the Cargo House, and even pulled in the Blueskin Thieves into his ploy.
And below that, is the seal and name of our current Fishbelly Pub Owner, Makara!

20005258.text:
Makara did all these horrible things for his own personal political gain!
Are! We! Going to allow someone like him to be the Fishbelly Pub's Owner?

20005259.text:
How could he be so shameless?
I can no longer acknowledge him as the owner!

20005261.text: Makara, come out and explain yourself!

20005262.text:
I think he made a run for it.
We've searched everywhere, but we couldn't find him.

20005263.text: Makara ran away? What's going to happen now...?

20005264.text:
We've got a suitable candidate!
Mehwa can be the new owner!

20005267.text:
I understand and respect your opinions.
However, I can't allow myself to be an opportunist and just take the empty seat as is.

20005268.text:
However, the position of the Fishbelly Pub Owner can't be left vacant for the sake of the Sapphire Basin.
Thus, the Saho will operate it together until the next candidate is chosen.

20005269.text: We've got nothing to worry about if it's the Saho!

20005270.text: Finally, the Sapphire Basin is returning to normal.

20005272.text:
Thank you for your help.
We're sorry, but there's something else we'd like you to take care of.

20005273.text:
About that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Makara</>, who ran away. I want you to find him.
The last time he was seen near the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Moonwater Harbor shipyard</>.

20005274.text:
He must be apprehended at once,
but none of us Saho can afford to leave our office at this moment.

20005275.text:
Makara won't stay here forever.
Please follow him for us.

20005277.text:
Furr, thank you.
Let me send you to Moonwater Harbor right away. Furrong, furrong, furororong!

20005278.text: So, did you bring the monster's head?

20005279.text: I've got the head right here.

20005280.text:
Impressive. I'm glad I'm in league with the Saho.
Now, the real business begins.

20005281.text:
The tent over there belongs to our boss.
Step into the tent with this head.

20005282.text:
Muster up all the politeness you've got and say you'd like to enter.
Don't you dare make him upset. Got it?

20005283.text:
I came because I was worried!
What happened to Steelfang?

20005284.text: (I managed to defeat Steelfang, but I feel livid after finding out who the mastermind was.)

20005285.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></> doesn't need to be sorry for it, plog.
You are a precious friend who has risked your life to help us.

20005286.text:
Thanks to you the day we get back our village is just around the corner, plog!
If that day comes, come visit our village!

20005289.text: (There's a suspicious letter between the piled-up cargo.)

20005290.text: (... I'm sending you plenty of military supplies you can use to inflict damage at the right time...)

20005291.text:
(There is Fishbelly Pub Owner <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Makara</>'s seal and name at the bottom of the letter.
The imposter who was aiding the Blue Bandits seems to have been <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Makara</>.)

20005293.text:
Hey, do you think we're on a picnic?
What took you so long?

20005294.text:
The Blue Bandits camp was so mazelike
that it took me a long time to find my way around.

20005295.text:
Hmph, forget it. See what's behind there?
We don't have time to waste. Go get its head this instant.

20005296.text: The treasured sword and Saberfang Leather of the Poacher Gang...? All right, then.

20005297.text:
(I've found an expensive-looking sword inside the chest.
This must be the Sword of Truth. Let's grab it.)

20005298.text:
(Oh! Chiyun told me to gather some Saberfang Leather while I was at it.
Let's find some Saberfangs. But how do I get their leather?)

20005299.text:
Hey, you! Do you know how much trouble I'm in with the boss because of you?
''ll show you what happens when a recruit goes to the boss's tent without permission!

20005300.text:
(Zadari seems upset that I spoke with Stonefist without his permission.
He doesn't look like he'll just let me leave. Ah! Perhaps this is why Chiyun told me to gather some Saberfang Leather?)

20005301.text:
(I should hand over the Saberfang Leather to Zadari... who isn't even looking at me.
I'll tell him I have something I must show to the leader.)

20005302.text:
Tsk. I told you recruits aren't allowed. Wait, what? This is Saberfang Leather? You're giving it to me?
And look at that fine quality! It could sell for a good amount of money... Hmph!

20005303.text:
Fine, so you know how to show some respect.
That's great. But you better be ready if you end up bothering the boss over something that's not important.
